resources:
/* 使用插件翻译的，准确性未知 */ LBL Welcome to LBL (Live Broadcast on LAN) This application is a lightweight application for LAN sharing of mobile phone screen for live broadcast. You can share the screen of this smartphone from a computer or smartphone connected to the same LAN. 
 To watch the live broadcast, just open the URL in a browser on another terminal, no software required. 
 Start Set up Screen sharing settings Update frequency, bitrate, FPS settings and more About Start the engine Can I say that it’s because I can’t watch my teammates after watching elimination replays in the game I’m playing, so I want to make a mobile screen sharing software similar to parsec\? (dog head) Version Notifications during LBL startup LBL is running You can see it from your browser IP address Video update frequency ​​ (seconds) Are you sure you want to reset\? Reset Reducing it will reduce the latency of playing videos in the browser Video bitrate (Kbps) Improve image quality at the expense of increased video size Video frame rate (fps) The smoothness of the video Record internal audio Android 10 or higher can combine the device's internal audio with video and send it, requiring microphone permissions Audio bitrate (Kbps) Sound quality. The port number If multiple users are using the same port at the same time, you need to change the port Permission denied Current time Start screen sharing End sharing Welcome to LBL ( Live Broadcast on LAN ) Click to see a brief description of this application View URL You can view the content of the screen share by entering this URL into the address field of your PC or mobile browser share Open the browser to check whether the sharing is successful Android 10 and above can share internal audio Microphone permission is required to use internal audio in screen sharing. Grant microphone permission Screen sharing quality information Video contains internal audio (Android 10 and above) Enable Not Enabled (Microphone permission is not granted and cannot be used) Update frequency (seconds) Video bitrate Video frame rate (fps) Audio bitrate Change settings QR code Specify video resolution If not specified, the default screen resolution will be used Video height Video width Advanced user settings Horizontal 1280, vertical 720 Video resolution MPEG-DASH mode Introduction:
 Screen sharing is based on MPEG-DASH technology, which is mostly used for real-time distribution. 
 The video codec uses VP9, the audio codec uses Opus, and the container uses WebM. 
 Requires a browser with available MediaSource Extensions API (mostly supported), some browser extensions may need to be disabled Streaming method Display mirror information in notification area No authorization is required to use, but in Android 13 and above, permission to send notifications is required to display the IP address and QR code in the notification area. Grant notification permissions Video codec using VP8 For users who don’t have a VP9 encoder on their phone (but most of them do) Mirror the output of an external monitor For applications that support external display output, mirror the output of the external display instead of the device. Behavior when connected to external display Settings changed during screen sharing, exit screen sharing Open on GitHub
